resources.string: Android Trivia will help remind you of important concepts you have learned and will learn in Android development.\n\nConsider modifying the questions and graphics to make this game your own!

Select the answer from the options given. Each time you get an answer correct, you advance to the next question.\n\nIf you get the answer wrong, your game ends! You can return to the title screen using up or back from within the game screen, and this will also end your game.

string.name: question1
string.span: Which of these is not a core data type?

resources.string: What data type is the object below? L = [1, 23, ‘hello’, 1]
______ expressions are used to create anonymous functions.
The \'&\' operator yields the bitwise ___ of its arguments, which must be integers.
The \'/\' (division) and \'//\' (floor division) operators yield the ________ of their arguments
The \'^\' operator yields the bitwise ___ of its arguments, which must be integers.
Which of the following function convert a string to a float in python
Python distinguishes between these number types:
There are currently two intrinsic set types:
Which of these are mapping types?
Which operator is overloaded by the or() function?
The following types are immutable sequences?
There are currently two intrinsic mutable sequence types:
It terminates the nearest enclosing loop
It continues the nearest enclosing loop
pass is a null operation — when it is executed, nothing happens
It continues with the next cycle of the nearest enclosing loop
It continues with the next cycle of the nearest function
It breaks the next cycle of the nearest enclosing loop
These represent unordered, finite sets of unique, immutable objects
These represent ordered, finite sets of unique, immutable objects
These represent ordered, infinite sets of unique, immutable objects
These represent unordered, finite sets of unique, mutable objects
These represent finite sets of objects indexed by arbitrary index sets
These represent infinite sets of objects indexed by arbitrary index sets
These represent finite lists of objects indexed by arbitrary index lists
These represent finite tuples of objects indexed by arbitrary index tuples
These are the types to which the function call operation can be applied
These are the types to which the function call operation can not be applied
These are the types to which the database call operation can be applied
These are the types to which the network call operation can be applied
A function or method which is defined using async def is called a coroutine function.
A function or method which is defined using inheritance is called a coroutine function.
A function or method which is defined using database call is called a coroutine function.
A function or method which is defined using network call is called a coroutine function.
